publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2488 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Fairtrade City—That the Parliament congratulates Aberdeen on its first anniversary as a Fairtrade city; welcomes the publication of a guide produced by the New Consumer magazine showing where to buy Fairtrade goods in the city, and urges other areas to follow Aberdeen’s example. Supported by: Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2488 Aberdeen Fairtrade City (lodged on 28 February 2005) Michael Matheson*

S2M-2488 Aberdeen Fairtrade City (lodged on 28 February 2005) Rosie Kane*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Patrick Harvie*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Eleanor Scott*, Mike Rumbles*, Tricia Marwick*, Dr Jean Turner*, Frances Curran*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Linda Fabiani*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S2M-2488 Aberdeen Fairtrade City (lodged on 28 February 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Tommy Sheridan*, Robin Harper*, Shiona Baird*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S2M-2488 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Fairtrade City—That the Parliament congratulates Aberdeen on its first anniversary as a Fairtrade city; welcomes the publication of a guide produced by the New Consumer magazine showing where to buy Fairtrade goods in the city, and urges other areas to follow Aberdeen’s example. Supported by: Donald Gorrie, Michael Matheson, Rosie Kane, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Stewart Stevenson, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Patrick Harvie, Rob Gibson, Mr Bruce McFee, Eleanor Scott, Mike Rumbles, Tricia Marwick, Dr Jean Turner, Frances Curran, Mr Adam Ingram, Linda Fabiani, Roseanna Cunningham, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Tommy Sheridan, Robin Harper, Shiona Baird, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2488 Aberdeen Fairtrade City (lodged on 28 February 2005) Nora Radcliffe*
